result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaias D Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Isaias D Rivera is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Isaias D Rivera was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Court ordered a fine in the amount of $2,500.00 including court costs and all applicable surcharges, including DNA sample and assessments out of cash bail on deposit.
-Provide a DNA sample
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may no longer use or possess any firearms and may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaias D Rivera

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No reply from defendant or surety. DZ
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500.00) gj
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Isaias D Rivera in court with attorney Matt Last.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right for State to file a complaint and conduct a preliminary hearing on COUNT 3.   State has no victim on COUNTS 1 and 2.  On motion of the defense, Court ordered COUNTS 1 and 2 DISMISSED.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY on COUNT 3.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the amended information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 59 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with credit for 59 days time served.  
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample 
-Court ordered defendant a fine in the amount of $2,500.00 INCLUDING Court costs and all applicable surcharges, including DNA sample and assessments out of cash bail on deposit. 
-Any remaining cash bail to be returned to person who posted.

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Isaias D Rivera in court with attorney Matt Last.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial conducted.  State still needs to determine if victim/witness still available.  Jury trial date is vacated.  Matter scheduled for plea/sentencing on new bail motion charges that will be issued.  Court will determine if these charges can go forward on the next Court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
From Attorney Matt Last requesting the final pretrial date be recalendared from September 26, 2016 to October 10, 2016.  Court grants request.

Case recalled.  Defense motion to dismiss denied by the Court.  State's motion to adjourn granted by the Court.  Amended Information, received and filed, charging Count 3, Bail Jumping (Felony), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.49(1)(b) and 939.50(3)(h), a Class H Felony.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pretrial conference and jury trial in Branch 19.  Court addresses the JusticePoint Program report received.  Court notes defendant continues to comply.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Isaias D Rivera in court with attorney Matt Last.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case recalled.  Parties have a possible resolution.  Case passed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JESUS F., LUXANDRA F. , ELICIA F., CYNTHIA F., VANESSA E. AND BYRON M.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Isaias D Rivera in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Isaias D Rivera in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

COURT ORDER SHERIFF DEPARTMENT TO OBTAIN DNA SAMPLE.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
